s.text: I actually won the debate in the eyes of the people polled.
You apparently represent the same money powers that are seeking to destroy the representative nature of our government.
You apparently represent the same money powers that are seeking to destroy the representative nature of our government.
Gary Bauer launched the only direct attack on a fellow candidate, when he once again hit Forbes, this time on Forbes's flat-tax proposal, which exempts inheritance and capital gains.
Bauer said that his father was a janitor and that this wasn't fair.
Bauer said that his father was a janitor and that this wasn't fair.

"The income tax is a form of tax that was advocated by Marx and Lenin because it cedes in principle to the government control of EVERY LAST DOLLAR that is made or earned in income," he bellowed, walking to the edge of the stage.

A New Hampshire television reporter who interviewed Bush before the debate asked if he wasn't trying to get the job of president without the job interview.
Several candidates took shots at Bush for his absence.
